page.title: 04THE BUILDINGS OF YANWORTH
page.content: {Yanworth has 2 definite parts. }To the east{the old church is surrounded {by fine old outbuildings and an old {tithe barn. }A track past four modern houses built in 1960 leads west to{a {country lane _ Yanworth's main street. These{stone houses}bear the date 1863. Apart from the extensions to some old barns little has changed for many years. {The stone farm buildings are {fine examples of the Cotswold style. In the middle of Yanworth care has been taken at the estate's tractor / machine base to build a big fuel tank and a workshop almost out of sight. Great pride and care is taken with the {private garden / vegetable plots. With all the land privately owned and with no likelihood of speculative building it seems that{Yanworth will {continue to look much the same for a {very long time.
